nodes.helpText: If the refusal creates immediate clinical danger, escalate per policy/provider direction.

options.label: Refusal of life‑sustaining care (e.g., airway/bleeding emergency)
Refusal of required infection control precautions during outbreak

nodes.prompt: What is being refused? (e.g., wound care, therapy, isolation, vitals)
Reason for refusal (select all that apply)
Does the resident appear to have capacity for this decision?
nodes.helpText: If uncertain, treat as change in condition and notify provider/supervisor per policy.

nodes.title: Education + alternatives
nodes.body: Explain purpose, risks/benefits, and alternatives in plain language. Offer options (timing, smaller steps, different staff approach) when feasible. Respect resident rights; avoid coercion.

nodes.helpText: Notify for repeated refusal, high‑risk refusal, or if capacity is uncertain.

nodes.title: Select actions to include in the progress note

items.text: Clarified what was refused and assessed clinical impact/risk
Assessed resident status (vitals/symptoms/mental status) and compared to baseline
Assessed capacity/understanding for this decision and documented findings
Provided education on purpose/risks/benefits and offered alternatives
Addressed comfort barriers (pain/anxiety) with allowed interventions
Planned re‑approach with modified approach/time/staff as appropriate
Monitored for clinical changes related to refusal and re‑evaluated risk
Escalated for deterioration, repeated refusals, or high‑risk refusal per policy
Documented refusal details, education provided, and resident response
Notified provider/supervisor/responsible party as indicated and documented outcome
Documented resident rights considerations and offered alternatives
Documented follow‑up plan and escalation triggers
